body_content.explanation: When two people own a property together and one of them dies, survivorship is the legal right of the survivor (= the person who is still living) to own the property:
examples: If two people purchase a home together and one dies, the contract would grant the remaining person survivorship.
Joint tenancy of the property provides the right of survivorship, and in this case is available only to a husband and wife.

body_content.explanation: the number of a particular type of plant or animal that lives to a given age:
examples: In recent years, the survivorship of the African elephant has improved quite dramatically.
This year’s late rain has not seriously affected the survivorship and performance of the 610 rice varieties on the farm.

body_content.explanation: the fact or condition of being a survivor (= a person who continues to live, despite nearly dying), especially from a disease such as cancer:
examples: He set up the foundation to raise awareness about issues related to cancer survivorship.
I was involved in planning the memorial from the beginning, partly because of my survivorship.
